thread.title: ICC declines term cut for Lubanga
thread.title_full: ICC declines term cut for Lubanga | News24

author: news24.com
title: ICC declines term cut for Lubanga
text:
Amsterdam - The International Criminal Court on Tuesday rejected an application by convicted Congolese war criminal Thomas Lubanga for his early release.
There were no important grounds for such a decision, the ICC said in The Hague.
Lubanga's defence had argued that he was eligible to be released after serving more than two-thirds of his 14-year sentence.
The 54-year-old warlord became the first person to be convicted by the ICC in 2012. He was found guilty of using child soldiers in a conflict in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo in 2002 and 2003.
